parameters.name: job
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the simulation job to be described.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the simulation job.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the simulation job.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the simulation job.

nested_items.name: lastStartedAt
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the simulation job was last started.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the simulation job was last updated.

nested_items.name: failureBehavior
nested_items.description: The failure behavior for the simulation job.

nested_items.name: failureCode
nested_items.description: The failure code of the simulation job if it failed:

nested_items.name: failureReason
nested_items.description: Details about why the simulation job failed. For more information about troubleshooting, see Troubleshooting.

nested_items.name: clientRequestToken
nested_items.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

nested_items.name: outputLocation
nested_items.description: Location for output files generated by the simulation job.

nested_items.name: s3Bucket
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket for output.

nested_items.name: s3Prefix
nested_items.description: The S3 folder in the s3Bucket where output files will be placed.

nested_items.name: loggingConfig
nested_items.description: The logging configuration.

nested_items.name: recordAllRosTopics
nested_items.description: A boolean indicating whether to record all ROS topics.

nested_items.name: maxJobDurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum job duration in seconds. The value must be 8 days (691,200 seconds) or less.

nested_items.name: simulationTimeMillis
nested_items.description: The simulation job execution duration in milliseconds.

nested_items.name: iamRole
nested_items.description: The IAM role that allows the simulation instance to call the AWS APIs that are specified in its associated policies on your behalf.

nested_items.name: robotApplications
nested_items.description: A list of robot applications.

nested_items.name: application
nested_items.description: The application information for the robot application.

nested_items.name: applicationVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the robot application.

nested_items.name: launchConfig
nested_items.description: The launch configuration for the robot application.

nested_items.name: packageName
nested_items.description: The package name.

nested_items.name: launchFile
nested_items.description: The launch file name.

nested_items.name: environmentVariables
nested_items.description: The environment variables for the application launch.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: portForwardingConfig
nested_items.description: The port forwarding configuration.

nested_items.name: portMappings
nested_items.description: The port mappings for the configuration.

nested_items.name: jobPort
nested_items.description: The port number on the simulation job instance to use as a remote connection point.

nested_items.name: applicationPort
nested_items.description: The port number on the application.

nested_items.name: enableOnPublicIp
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether to enable this port mapping on public IP.

nested_items.name: streamUI
nested_items.description: Boolean indicating whether a streaming session will be configured for the application. If True, AWS RoboMaker will configure a connection so you can interact with your application as it is running in the simulation. You must configure and launch the component. It must have a graphical user interface.

nested_items.name: command
nested_items.description: If you've specified General as the value for your RobotSoftwareSuite, you can use this field to specify a list of commands for your container image.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: uploadConfigurations
nested_items.description: The upload configurations for the robot application.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: A prefix that specifies where files will be uploaded in Amazon S3. It is appended to the simulation output location to determine the final path.

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: Specifies the path of the file(s) to upload. Standard Unix glob matching rules are accepted, with the addition of ** as a super asterisk. For example, specifying /var/log/**.log causes all .log files in the /var/log directory tree to be collected. For more examples, see Glob Library.

nested_items.name: uploadBehavior
nested_items.description: Specifies when to upload the files:

nested_items.name: useDefaultUploadConfigurations
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether to use default upload configurations. By default, .ros and .gazebo files are uploaded when the application terminates and all ROS topics will be recorded.

nested_items.name: tools
nested_items.description: Information about tools configured for the robot application.

nested_items.name: streamUI
nested_items.description: Boolean indicating whether a streaming session will be configured for the tool. If True, AWS RoboMaker will configure a connection so you can interact with the tool as it is running in the simulation. It must have a graphical user interface. The default is False.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the tool.

nested_items.name: command
nested_items.description: Command-line arguments for the tool. It must include the tool executable name.

nested_items.name: streamOutputToCloudWatch
nested_items.description: Boolean indicating whether logs will be recorded in CloudWatch for the tool. The default is False.

nested_items.name: exitBehavior
nested_items.description: Exit behavior determines what happens when your tool quits running. RESTART will cause your tool to be restarted. FAIL will cause your job to exit. The default is RESTART.

nested_items.name: useDefaultTools
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether to use default robot application tools. The default tools are rviz, rqt, terminal and rosbag record. The default is False.

nested_items.name: simulationApplications
nested_items.description: A list of simulation applications.

nested_items.name: application
nested_items.description: The application information for the simulation application.

nested_items.name: applicationVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the simulation application.

nested_items.name: launchConfig
nested_items.description: The launch configuration for the simulation application.

nested_items.name: packageName
nested_items.description: The package name.

nested_items.name: launchFile
nested_items.description: The launch file name.

nested_items.name: environmentVariables
nested_items.description: The environment variables for the application launch.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: portForwardingConfig
nested_items.description: The port forwarding configuration.

nested_items.name: portMappings
nested_items.description: The port mappings for the configuration.

nested_items.name: jobPort
nested_items.description: The port number on the simulation job instance to use as a remote connection point.

nested_items.name: applicationPort
nested_items.description: The port number on the application.

nested_items.name: enableOnPublicIp
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether to enable this port mapping on public IP.

nested_items.name: streamUI
nested_items.description: Boolean indicating whether a streaming session will be configured for the application. If True, AWS RoboMaker will configure a connection so you can interact with your application as it is running in the simulation. You must configure and launch the component. It must have a graphical user interface.

nested_items.name: command
nested_items.description: If you've specified General as the value for your RobotSoftwareSuite, you can use this field to specify a list of commands for your container image.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: uploadConfigurations
nested_items.description: Information about upload configurations for the simulation application.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: A prefix that specifies where files will be uploaded in Amazon S3. It is appended to the simulation output location to determine the final path.

nested_items.name: path
nested_items.description: Specifies the path of the file(s) to upload. Standard Unix glob matching rules are accepted, with the addition of ** as a super asterisk. For example, specifying /var/log/**.log causes all .log files in the /var/log directory tree to be collected. For more examples, see Glob Library.

nested_items.name: uploadBehavior
nested_items.description: Specifies when to upload the files:

nested_items.name: worldConfigs
nested_items.description: A list of world configurations.

nested_items.name: world
nested_items.description: The world generated by Simulation WorldForge.

nested_items.name: useDefaultUploadConfigurations
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether to use default upload configurations. By default, .ros and .gazebo files are uploaded when the application terminates and all ROS topics will be recorded.

nested_items.name: tools
nested_items.description: Information about tools configured for the simulation application.

nested_items.name: streamUI
nested_items.description: Boolean indicating whether a streaming session will be configured for the tool. If True, AWS RoboMaker will configure a connection so you can interact with the tool as it is running in the simulation. It must have a graphical user interface. The default is False.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the tool.

nested_items.name: command
nested_items.description: Command-line arguments for the tool. It must include the tool executable name.

nested_items.name: streamOutputToCloudWatch
nested_items.description: Boolean indicating whether logs will be recorded in CloudWatch for the tool. The default is False.

nested_items.name: exitBehavior
nested_items.description: Exit behavior determines what happens when your tool quits running. RESTART will cause your tool to be restarted. FAIL will cause your job to exit. The default is RESTART.

nested_items.name: useDefaultTools
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether to use default simulation application tools. The default tools are rviz, rqt, terminal and rosbag record. The default is False.

nested_items.name: dataSources
nested_items.description: The data sources for the simulation job.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the data source.

nested_items.name: s3Bucket
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket where the data files are located.

nested_items.name: s3Keys
nested_items.description: The list of S3 keys identifying the data source files.

nested_items.name: s3Key
nested_items.description: The S3 key.

nested_items.name: etag
nested_items.description: The etag for the object.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The data type for the data source that you're using for your container image or simulation job. You can use this field to specify whether your data source is an Archive, an Amazon S3 prefix, or a file.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The location where your files are mounted in the container image.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: vpcConfig
nested_items.description: The VPC configuration.

nested_items.name: subnets
nested_items.description: A list of subnet IDs associated with the simulation job.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: securityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of security group IDs associated with the simulation job.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: vpcId
nested_items.description: The VPC ID associated with your simulation job.

nested_items.name: assignPublicIp
nested_items.description: A boolean indicating if a public IP was assigned.

nested_items.name: networkInterface
nested_items.description: The network interface information for the simulation job.

nested_items.name: networkInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the network interface.

nested_items.name: privateIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IPv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.

nested_items.name: publicIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IPv4 public address of the network interface.

nested_items.name: simulationUnitLimit
nested_items.description: The simulation unit limit. Your simulation is allocated CPU and memory proportional to the supplied simulation unit limit. A simulation unit is 1 vcpu and 2GB of memory. You are only billed for the SU utilization you consume up to the maximum value provided. The default is 15.

nested_items.name: computeType
nested_items.description: Compute type response information for the simulation job.

nested_items.name: gpuUnitLimit
nested_items.description: Compute GPU unit limit for the simulation job. It is the same as the number of GPUs allocated to the SimulationJob.
